items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Speeding Lamborghini car crashes into Mumbai Coastal Road divider, driver escapes unhurt
items.summary: police suspect that the wet road led to the accident, as there was a downpour in the city, though some retired RTO officials also pointed to the possibility of hydroplaning or aquaplaning

items.title: Over 1.37 lakh metric tons of fresh fruit, including apples, dispatched outside Kashmir in 10 days: J&K Government
items.summary: The movement of fresh fruit, especially apples, was halted due to heavy rains that resulted in the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway for three weeks

items.title: Afghan boy lands in Delhi by hiding in plane's landing gear
items.summary: He told the officials that he sneaked into the Kabul airport and somehow managed to get inside the rear central landing gear compartment of the said aircraft

items.title: H-1B’s new $100k visa fee: Why young Indian women are most at risk
items.summary: The impact will be particularly felt by women H-1B beneficiaries as they generally earn less than men

items.title: Heavy rain likely in Odisha due to fresh low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal
items.summary: Heavy rainfall would occur in the districts of Sundargarh, Sambalpur, Deogarh, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj, Jharsuguda, Angul, Boudh, Sonepur, Malkangiri, Koraput, Nabarangpur, and Kalahandi on September 23

items.title: Morning Digest: British PM Keir Starmer likely to visit India in October; Jaishankar, Rubio meet amid trade, visa tensions, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Focus is on IT, but not at the cost of agriculture, says A.P. CM Naidu
items.summary: Naidu asks MLAs and MLCs to spend a day every month in the fields, interact with the farmers and solve their problems

items.title: Deputy CM inaugurates training camp; TNUHDB housing units
Three youths detained under Goondas Act
HR&CE Dept conducting festivals for saints including Nathamunigal, Thirunavukkarasar: Minister
Cigarettes, e-cigarettes worth ₹1.33 crore seized at Chennai Air Cargo
Gunman dead after opening fire on Amazon facility in Georgia
items.summary: The suspect, whose name wasn't released, fired multiple gunshots into the facility from the outside, Columbus police said in a statement. His death was self-inflicted, police said. No other deaths or injuries were reported

items.title: Teenager dies after clash in Chennai
items.summary: Harshvardhan, who was critically injured, was admitted at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital where he succumbed to injuries on Sunday evening

items.title: Ceylon Workers Congress leader calls on Chief Minister Stalin
Agnikul Cosmos commissions addictive manufacturing facility for rocket systems
items.summary: The facility also enables 3D printing of aerospace and rocket components up to one metre in height.

items.title: Krishna water supply to Chennai likely to stop by September-end; WRD boosts Chembarambakkam reservoir storage
items.summary: Officials of the WRD said the AP authorities are expected to halt water discharge from the Kandaleru reservoir to facilitate maintenance work on the Kandaleru-Poondi canal within their jurisdiction.

items.title: Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger withdraw from International Criminal Court
items.summary: The court, based in The Hague, was "an instrument of neo-colonialist repression in the hands of imperialism," the three countries said in a joint statement

items.title: Copenhagen airport reopens following drone disruption
items.summary: Flights at Copenhagen Airport were suspended or diverted due to sightings of large drones

items.title: Spain’s top diplomat dismisses Israeli leader’s vow of no Palestinian state, saying it will happen
items.summary: Spain’s top diplomat dismissed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s statement that there will never be a Palestinian state

items.title: Under BJP rule, Odisha reports 37,611 crimes against women in just 14 months
items.summary: Molestation tops the list with 9,181 cases, followed by abduction of women (8,227), non-dowry torture (6,134), and dowry torture (5,464).

items.title: NC MP Ruhullah seeks immediate, unconditional release of rights activist Khurram Parvez
items.summary: For over 1,400 days, the BJP-RSS regime has kept Kashmiri human rights defender Khurram Parvez in unlawful captivity, says National Conference (NC) leader and MP Aga Syed Ruhullah

items.title: Trump administration suggests Tylenol during pregnancy causes autism; experts say link unproven
items.summary: The Trump administration has been under immense pressure from Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s diverse Make America Healthy Again movement to provide answers on the causes of the marked increase in autism cases in the U.S. in recent years.

items.title: Supreme Court assigns CBI plea on Shivakumar case to Justice Kant’s Bench
items.summary: CBI filed the petition after Karnataka govt. revoked the consent given to the probe agency to investigate the disproportionate assets case against Shivakumar

items.title: Rubio meets Syria's leader in New York as the country's isolation eases further
items.summary: They discussed ongoing counterterrorism efforts, efforts to locate missing Americans, and the importance of Israel-Syria relations in achieving greater regional security, says the State Department statement

items.title: France recognises Palestinian statehood at U.N. meeting to revive peace efforts
items.summary: The time has come to free the 48 hostages held by Hamas. The time has come to stop the war, the bombings of Gaza, the massacres and the displacement, says French President Emmanuel Macron

items.title: Students launch protest in Dehradun against paper leak, says anti-cheating law is no deterrent
items.summary: Demanding justice for those who spent months preparing for exams and ended up losing it to paper leak, students alleged that the anti-cheating law remain no deterrent for the cheating mafias in the State.

items.title: Adolescence writer on new phone-hacking drama: 'It's a celebration of journalists who called out their own industry'
items.summary: Jack Thorne says the phone hacking scandal exposed a "troubling" relationship between the press and the police.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh government issues order prohibiting caste-based political rallies in State
items.summary: Notification follows directive by Allahabad HC on Sept. 16 to curb glorification of caste and its mention in police cases; Oppn. alleges BJP itself held caste rallies and conferences in the past

items.title: France formally recognises Palestinian state
items.summary: Speaking at the UN in New York, President Emmanuel Macron said "the time for peace has come".

items.title: Copenhagen Airport reopens after drone sightings as origins still unclear
items.summary: Danish police said that they were unable to confirm the type or the number of drones seen around the airport, or where they flew afterwards.

items.title: One killed, 14 stranded in floodwaters as heavy rains wreak havoc in Maharashtra
items.summary: The fatality occurred due to a lightning strike in Nanded district; while 12 people were stranded in Dharashiv district, two others were trapped due to flooding of the Sina river in Barshi of Solapur district

items.title: I didn't want sex with my husband after having our baby
items.summary: Both women and men can experience a loss of libido after having a child, here's what can help.

items.title: A golden tribute: French-Bengali art collaboration brings Kolkata’s ghats to life at Durga Puja pandal
items.summary: Hatibagan Sarbojanin’s pandal blends European artistry with Bengal’s heritage, showcasing Kolkata’s history in shimmering golden threads

items.title: British PM Keir Starmer likely to visit India in October
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Starmer will hold summit-level talks during the visit, which comes a little more than two months after Mr. Modi visited the U.K. to attend the signing of the U.K.-India free trade agreement.

items.title: Woman’s decomposed body found in Delhi apartment, gaunt husband, disabled son rescued
Government announces ₹1,000 crore programme to drive innovation, entrepreneurial growth across Karnataka
items.summary: The Department of Electronics, IT and BT on Monday unveiled a ₹1,000-crore Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) to drive innovation across the State

items.title: Social and Educational Survey expected to take at least a week to begin in Bengaluru
items.summary: There are not enough government school teachers to carry out the survey in Bengaluru

items.title: GST 2.0: Ministers, Delhi CM reach out to traders in city markets
items.summary: Nadda, Sitharaman, along with Delhi BJP MPs, speak to shopkeepers, take feedback; Rekha Gupta urges people to go swadeshi; reform will energise economy ahead of Deepavali, Chhath: Mishra

items.title: The Papers:  'Farage plan would split families' and 'Will the King banish Fergie?'
items.summary: Reform's migration plans and the Duchess of York being dropped from charities make Tuesday's front pages.

items.title: Gang of four loots ₹1.5 crore from the house of  professor
BBMP’s e-Khata Wins National Award 2025
Delhi HC seeks DU’s reply to ‘EVM tampering’ claim by outgoing union president
Nine-year-old sexually assaulted by head of children’s home in Hosur
items.summary: The police have arrested five persons in connection with the crime and attempt to cover it up. Among them are the director of the home, his wife, and a pastor of a local church

items.title: Malaria cases surge past 300 mark in city, dengue tally increases to 685
items.summary: A total of 333 cases were recorded across the city till September 20

items.title: Jimmy Kimmel show to return after suspension over Charlie Kirk comments
items.summary: The late-night comic's show will return to air after Disney said it had "thoughtful coversations" with him.

items.title: Canteens operated by Mahalir Thittam SHGs to be opened in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges
items.summary: The institutions have been advised to allocate suitable space on the campuses to set up the canteens and ensure basic facilities such as water, electricity, and waste management support

items.title: Minister for retired army personnel as security supervisors in Telangana Govt. hospitals
items.summary: Officials highlighted gaps in sanitation, security, patient care, and diet services.

items.title: Govt. gets NHRC notices over injuries, death of sewer cleaners
Confusion and transition pain in Hyderabad’s retail sector as GST 2.0 rolls out
Aavin offers festival discount; activists raise questions over GST 2.0 changes
Realising the full potential of GST reforms
items.summary: Supply side measures are necessary to ensure minimal effect to the States

items.title: Chess player R. Vaishali and other sportspersons get postings in government establishments
Data labelling for AI mirrors the act of parenting: Filmmaker Aranya Sahay
Tamil Nadu Nurses Empowerment Association plans series of protests to press key demands
items.summary: These include the halting of low-paid contractual appointments in the Tamil Nadu government medical services and implementation of the DMK’s poll promise to regularise nurses recruited on consolidated pay through the Medical Services Recruitment Board

items.title: Congress MLA’s call for coalition govt. after 2026 poll sparks divide in Tamil Nadu Congress Committee
items.summary: Among a section of Congress functionaries, there is a feeling that the ruling DMK has kept allies at a distance, hardly consulting them or hearing their grievances

items.title: Following Allahabad HC’s directives, Uttar Pradesh prohibits caste mention in FIR, political rallies, public signs
items.summary: Ordering a prohibition on caste-based rallies, officiating Chief Secretary (CS) Deepak Kumar said they are organised for political purposes and promote caste conflict in society, which is contrary to “public order” and “national unity.”

items.title: Kerala HC dismisses businessman’s plea
Plea in Delhi High Court seeks removal of graves of Afzal Guru, Maqbool Bhatt from Tihar jail premises
items.summary: The plea sought directions to authorities to relocate the mortal remains, if necessary, to a secret location to prevent “glorification of terrorism” and misuse of jail premises

items.title: Woman arrested for murder in Coimbatore
Star-studded, iconic, Oscar-winning mafia epic
items.summary: Oscar-winning adaptation of Mario Puzo’s epic bestseller.

items.title: Recognising Palestinian statehood opens another question - who would lead it?
items.summary: With the president approaching 90 years of age and another possible candidate in jail, finding the right leadership would be a challenge

items.title: Woman killed, another injured in road accident
Assam CM orders autopsy of Garg’s remains after aide is accused of ‘overworking singer’
items.summary: The Chief Minister stated that a post-mortem was ordered in response to public demand. Fans will have the opportunity to pay their last respects to Zubeen

items.title: HC concerned at alleged lack of hygiene on Chottanikkara temple premises
A step towards carbon neutral Goshree
On World Car-Free Day, commuters in Bengaluru demand: ‘Double the Bus’
Odisha Speaker rejects no-confidence motion moved by Congress
items.summary: The rejection of no-confidence motion notice was deliberate, alleged Congress Legislature Party leader Ramachandra Kadam

items.title: Government transfers major road work to BSMILE from GBA
HC sets aside circular of RERA-Karnataka imposing ‘delay fee’ for submitting quarterly updates on approved real estate projects after deadline
M. Leelavathy book corner opened in Thrikkakara library
US Supreme Court to revisit laws curtailing Trump's power to fire top officials
items.summary: The ruling allows the president to remove the sole Democratic official on the Federal Trade Commission, an independent body set up by Congress.

items.title: Doctors’ strike hits healthcare services in Manipur
items.summary: Protesting the assault of a colleague, the State unit of the Indian Medical Association and other medical bodies announced a 24-hour suspension of services at private and government facilities from 6 a.m. on September 23

items.title: Two killed as three-storey building collapses in Indore
items.summary: District Collector Shivam Verma said that 14 members of a family were trapped under the debris of the building.

items.title: Nearly 1,500 potholes within GBA will be filled everyday: GBA Chief
Tamil Nadu govt. to sign MoU with Railways in December for CMRL takeover of MRTS
items.summary: At a high-level meeting held on Monday, the State government gave in-principle approval for the signing of the MoU. The government also approved the Comprehensive Mobility Plan for Chennai

items.title: Britain's worst major stations for train cancellations revealed - is yours on the list?
items.summary: Figures show around one in 13 scheduled stops at City Thameslink were cancelled over the past year

items.title: Davey urges US cancer scientists to come to UK
items.summary: The Lib Dem leader will use his party conference speech to attack Donald Trump's "anti-science agenda".

items.title: Vijayawada Utsav kicks off to a grand start, Gollapudi Exhibition Grounds reopens after 12 years
India, Morocco sign defence cooperation MoU to boost strategic partnership
items.summary: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh also announces opening of a new Defence Wing at the Embassy of India in Rabat, Morocco’s capital; the MoU establishes a robust institutional framework for expanding ties, paving the way for collaboration in defence industry, joint exercises, military training, and capa

items.title: How the simmering row over freedom of speech reached boiling point
items.summary: How did we reach a point where the UK is being compared to a 'tin pot Third World dictatorship'?

items.title: Dozens arrested, hurt in clashes with police near Philippine presidential palace
items.summary: Protesters expressed outrage over a corruption scandal involving lawmakers, officials and construction company owners who allegedly pocketed huge kickbacks from flood-control projects in the impoverished Southeast Asian country

items.title: Structured approach is key to tackling CSE: Seemanth Kumar Singh
Indian Navy scales up indigenous shipbuilding with 54 vessels under construction
items.summary: 54 vessels are currently under various stages of construction in Indian shipyards; several ships are nearing delivery, with a few to be commissioned this year; India has set a target of expanding naval strength to over 200 warships and submarines by 2035

items.title: Police probing Shine defamation case search Cong. worker’s house, seize phone
Economists warn about ‘collapse’ of public interest media
items.summary: Online platforms such as Meta and Google captured the bulk of online advertising revenues, while new AI chatbots such as ChatGPT or Google's Gemini have dramatically reduced the number of people accessing media company websites for information.

items.title: New hospitality projects in the pipeline, says Varun Group chairman
Navaratri idols reach Thiruvananthapuram from across the border
items.summary: The arrival marks the formal beginning of the annual Navaratri celebrations

items.title: Government specifies tasks of Ministries during calamities
items.summary: The Home Ministry said the Defence Ministry “shall have the responsibility for monitoring, early warning, prevention, mitigation, preparedness and capacity building” with regard to disaster arising from avalanche and oil spills

items.title: Eight scientists from BDU are among top 2% of Stanford University rankings list
Duchess of York dropped from multiple charities over Epstein email
items.summary: Seven charities, including the Teenage Cancer Trust, remove the former wife of Prince Andrew as a patron or ambassador.

items.title: Ocean clean-up drive held at Agatti
Chennai’s Victoria Public Hall is likely to be inaugurated next month after retrofitting
items.summary: A city museum will come up downstairs in the 2,200-square metre structure, while the galleries upstairs will host music and arts events.  A decision on a sound and light show is likely to be taken later

items.title: Over 1,000 employees of Electricity Department stage ‘Maha Shanti rally’ in Ongole
RO plants installed in 41 schools at Kalamassery
France and other countries to recognise Palestinian state as U.N. week gets underway
items.summary: Emmanuel Macron said he would make the release of hostages taken by Hamas during its October 7, attack on Israel a precondition of opening an embassy to the Palestinian state.

items.title: First admission at Kasaragod Govt. Medical College marks historic milestone
Training for women in Ayurveda-based postpartum care
SIR being forced upon Kerala, says KPCC chief
Police review security atop Indrakeeladri through CCTVs
